newsitem.title: GERMANY: Porsche may make sport utility car alone.
newsitem.headline: Porsche may make sport utility car alone.

text.p: Porsche AG, maker of the famed sports car, is willing to develop a sport utility vehicle by itself after efforts to find a partner have fallen through, Chairman Wendelin Wiedeking told a newspaper Thursday.
Wiedeking told the Handelsblatt newspaper that improved economic conditions made it possible for the company to produce such a vehicle on its own, assuming certain conditions were met.
Porsche had previously said it was in talks with Mercedes-Benz to jointly produce a sport utility vehicle in the United States based on the Mercedes M-Class.
The talks collapsed in January because of concerns at Mercedes that the car would not be profitable enough.
Wiedeking said production of a sport utility car would give Porsche's sales a new dimension, making it less dependent on what can be a fickle sports car market.
Porsche currently makes only two models, the 911 and the recently introduced Boxster.
